title: "What is the Relationship Between Papus and the Western Christian Initiation Tradition?"
first_phrase: In this article, the author discusses the role played by Papus in promoting the idea that the Western Christian initiatic tradition is not only orthodox, but also the only tradition of the West. After a disagreement with H.P. Blavatsky's Theosophical Society, Papus founded the Martinist order, which aimed to promote the initiatic tradition of the West. This led to a perceived rivalry between the Eastern and Western traditions. However, this is absurd as both traditions are connected to the same initiatic hierarchy. The article concludes by discussing how the relationship between the Martinist order and Theosophical Society evolved over time, leading to the creation of the Anthroposophical Society by Rudolf Steiner.

last_phrase: In conclusion, despite the attempts of assimilation between Martinism and Anthroposophy, there are still disagreements regarding the role of Jesus in initiation and history. It is important to clarify the meaning and extent of Eastern and Western traditions, including the Western Christian initiation, to better understand their place in the universe.
